@Booterslp @AmishaWalliaMD @debofficially @BrandisFriedman @ChiPubSchools @janicejackson @wttw @NUFeinbergMed @RushMedical @IMPACT4HC Agree-rates climbing and the incidence of COVID-19 amongst my patients palpably rising‚Äî that‚Äôs why we say the most important way we can reopen schools is to act responsibly as decrease transmission in the communities schools serve...

@Booterslp @AmishaWalliaMD @debofficially @BrandisFriedman @ChiPubSchools @janicejackson @wttw @NUFeinbergMed @RushMedical @IMPACT4HC CPS has it very tough. Many moving parts, not enough resources. Teachers are facing personal risk just like we are in healthcare, and teachers need to be protected. Many of our risk mitigation tactics in healthcare could be applied to schools with the right resources.

@LJoyZ_MD @AmishaWalliaMD @debofficially @BrandisFriedman @ChiPubSchools @janicejackson @wttw @NUFeinbergMed @RushMedical @IMPACT4HC And yet the rates are still so high. I‚Äôm not blaming you, but I feel, like many teachers out there, the cognitive dissonance when we hear the mayor say 1 thing & the Board say something else. And I don‚Äôt trust CPS to monitor the schools. The principals will do whatever they want.

@Booterslp @AmishaWalliaMD @debofficially @BrandisFriedman @ChiPubSchools @janicejackson @wttw @NUFeinbergMed @RushMedical @IMPACT4HC There are ways to keep all communities safe‚Äî we serve many in these communities. We need to take evidence-based approaches to safely reopening schools. Cohorting, masking, temp checks, symptom screening, curbside pick up- drop off, etc.

@AmishaWalliaMD @debofficially @BrandisFriedman @ChiPubSchools @janicejackson @wttw @NUFeinbergMed @RushMedical @LJoyZ_MD @IMPACT4HC Really? Maybe the doctors can come out to the west side and the south side where the Covid rate is much higher and explain to those people living there why it‚Äôs safe. Especially when most studies say that a safe return is dependent on the rate of infection in the community.
@avolgman @RushMedical Thank you @avolgman ‚ô•Ô∏è

"Research shows companies benefit from diversity. Your institution will thrive because you have different voices at the table. It‚Äôs not just nice to do. At the end of the day diversity and inclusion can benefit everyone."-Darlene Oliver Hightower of @RushMedical at #IHASummit2020

"It's not just about this year's civil unrest. Think beyond the 'right now.' I promise you this is ongoing, it's not going away." - Darlene Oliver Hightower of @RushMedical offers insight on #healthdisparities and #implicitbias at #IHASummit2020

"People are uncomfortable with tough conversations on bias & race. They might think 'I'm not racist' but that puts walls up. Look at it systemically, not personally. It's not a personal attack. What do we see in the data?"
- Darlene Oliver Hightower, @RushMedical @ #IHASummit2020
"If you find there are disparities in results of patient satisfaction surveys, you can identify further disparities." - Darlene Oliver Hightower of @RushMedical at the virtual #IHASummit2020

Good morning! The virtual #IHASummit2020 continues today with speakers from @UChicagoMed, @RushMedical and @ahahospitals. A special discussion at 11:30 will put the spotlight on #healthequity and #implicitbias, critical issues for Illinois healthcare.
